data.title: Good local Mexican restaurant
data.text:
I've been to El Tio several times, for lunch. The food there seems to vary, better than average sometimes, but only average at other times (maybe they have several chefs?). They seem to aspire to be a upscale, it is slightly more fancy than the average American-Mexican restaurant. Prices may be a little above local average; but it's still very reasonable, not expensive for what you get. The place in NR is relatively small, and can get crowded. NR Location is great, right across from the parking garage, close to the big movie theater. I've been there when the mole sauce was excellent; and at other times when it was just OK. I've never had a "bad" meal there, but I've had a bland meal there. Service has always been OK, no problems.

I do recommend El Tio; it has always been at least "good;" and sometimes better than just average.

data.title: average mexican food. great location
data.text: food is average. they give free chips and salsa which is nice. I always go for the blue margaritas which are good. its located across from the movie theaters, fun zone, applebees, the gym, sports authority, buffalo wild wings. parking on the street no parking lot. prices are average not too much. nothing fancy.

data.title: Nice, good Mole
data.text: The restaurant was quiet on a cold mid-week evening, but the food was great and the cocktails are good as well.   I had the Chili Relleno with mole and it was excellent, I would surely order this again, but also look forward to trying other dishes.   The service was friendly and prompt, and the décor is comfortable.

data.title: Not so cool...
data.text: The service here is friendly, but the food is mediocre...didn't have a heck of a lot of flavor, but it was ok.  Plus, they don't offer free refills of soda or iced tea (they charge $2.50 each). But what I found to be an abomination was when we got the check.  We were only a party of three -- for lunch -- and the restaurant had already added an 18% gratuity to the total.  The menu said that they automatically add a gratuity when there are EIGHT people (which is customary and expected)... but we were THREE.  Our bill came to $51 + some change, and when we asked the waiter about the already-added tip, he said that they recently decided to automatically add the 18% gratuity to any bill totaling over $50.00 "because a lot of times, we don't get tips."  There was no notification of this new policy anywhere...not on the door, the menu, the wall, nothing.  So if someone isn't paying careful attention to the bill, you could easily end up tipping them twice, like we almost did.  He would have had a $21 tip on a $50 check if we had not spotted it. [Ironically, he actually would have gotten more of a tip (20%) if he had left it to our discretion, so he cheated himself of $3.]  I find this practice to be pretty sneaky and underhanded given that they don't notify you clearly.  Couple that with just mediocre food, I have been completely turned off from returning.   There is a Marriott Hotel right across the street.  If you are staying there, don't go to El Tio's...there is a new Texas Roadhouse steakhouse only a half a block away that is fantastic!  Take the two minute walk and go there instead!

data.title: We go there all the time - always solid
data.text: Convenient location across the street from New Roc. Authentic Mexican. Extensive menu and friendly service. Try the ceviche appetizer. Good mojito. Reasonably priced. Child-friendly

data.title: Not a good choice for me
data.text: I stayed at the hotel across the street and decided to try this place.  It was average at best.  The chips and salsa they served was like the Cassadia (sp?). The chips didn't have much to them and the salsa had absolutely no flavor.  On top of that the wait staff (2 people) acted as if they could have cared less if I was there or not.  I will bypass this restaurant on my next visit to this area.

data.title: Horrible service and food wasn't that good
data.text:
Horrible Service and the food made me sick for like 3 days. Omar the night server decided to charge me over 25% more without my consent, when I wanted to ask him why he did that? He said because my wife didn't tip him a month ago on a $12 dollar charged. When we check the bank account she had tip him $5 bucks. Either way I think it was rood of him by taking a decision like this. This is how restaurants loose not one but two customers!!

Then I called back to speak to the manager and the server answer the phone and then changed his story to, "I was rude to the waitress when I question the amount and that's why they charged me what they charged me". 

Don't get the "Queso fundido with sausage" it's horrible and very grease compare to other places.  My stomachs hurt after I ate the Queso fundido. 

Place it's kind of expensive for the quality of food.

data.title: loved it
data.text: i have gone there a few times and i really enjoy the food. the food is made fresh and the chicken fajitas are delicious.  the service is slow but the food makes up for it. it is a nice casual place to eat.

data.title: GREAT, flavorful food
data.text: I decided to come to El Tio on a whim -- just needed something to eat on a Saturday night and I'm so glad I did. Quick service, plenty of food choices and delicious food. Good portions and reasonably priced. I had the enchiladas suizas (chicken) & they were DELICIOUS! They came with guac, sour cream & salsa...and the combination was perfect. Dish also came with rice & refried beans. The rice is a little 'sticky' but incredibly delicious. I loved every delicious bite and I'll definitely be coming back. I love it when a 'whim' pays off!!

data.title: Bad service and bad food
data.text:
So I've know, el tio restaurant for about 20 years, they started in Port Chester, back then when the food was good and this restaurant was owner operated, when they opened the New Rochelle restaurant we were happy and we started to visit this restaurant,  ever since the beginning the service has been super slow so if you go there on Saturday plan on waiting for your drinks at least for 15 min and for your food about 40-50 min, this won't change trust me not matter how busy or slow they are the waitress always seem to be lost or confused you end up feeling some how ignored. today it was the last visit to el tio, first of all, all this years we could not stand how slow and bad the waitress were, they have not idea how to properly serve a customer, we keep coming back just because of the food, the cook looked like he know what he was doing, the last 3 or 4 visits besides getting the bad service from waitress my husband order the fajita asada dish and even after telling them that we want this meat medium rare, they brought  it burned, it happen the last 2 visits, today was the worse they brought this fajitas burned again.. And cold, my food was steak and shrimp dish it was also cold. we waited like 50 min for the food and when they bring it it looks like it's been sitting there for 15-20 min, not to mention we waited like 20 to be sited and once on the table we were ignored for like another 20 min. When I decided to ask someone who is the waitress here? They looked at me and said let me find out, he asked someone then this other asked somebody else, no body seemed to know, we sat on the table that had not waitress assigned,  so long story short, you are always going to get slow and bad service, the food it's bad if you order steak be prepared to have it burn and dry unless you order really rare I will assumed they will bring it well done, if you want to get so desperate that you almost loose your appetite and ruin your Saturday night with your family, this is the place to go, be prepared to be forced to tip the mediocre waitress they add the tip to the bill
Sorry tio your loyal customers for 20 years are gone, you really kick us out

data.title: I didn't even get my water!
data.text:
If you had to ask to be helped and serviced then it's not a good restaurant. There was no hostess to greet you. Employers had walked right by without acknowledging you. Maybe they were overwhelmed because of the crowd. 

Finally sat down. No waiter came by to greet us. 15 minutes went by without being acknowledged. Didn't get the free chips. Customer service is key for a successful restaurant in my opinion. My girlfriend went to a waitress to see if we could be served and the lady didn't seem happy and kept her head down like she was ashamed. A waiter finally came about but didn't seem enthusiastic about it. We just wanted ordered drinks and appetizers. So we got our drinks and one of our appetizers which was chips and guacamole.  There were no napkins nor utensils on the table. We couldn't wipe our hands or anything. We finished the chips and waited for our waiter again to ask for water and napkins. There were two tables next to us he was also waiting, and he came by to collect their plates. He went to both of their tables and neglected our finished plate. We were quite agitated by this time. So when he came back around to check his other patrons I had to stretch my voice to get his attention. I asked for the napkins and two waters. My girlfriend made a joke saying it'll take another five minutes to ten minutes for those items. AND SHE WAS RIGHT! We received our napkins but no water. We were done waiting for to be served properly and for our food.  It was appetizers! How long does appetizers take? I noticed that a group that had just sat down minutes received their appetizers instantly. So we decided to forget the appetizers and just ask for the check and leave. So we asked for the check, and the waiter has the nerve to say that the food is coming. It's been 30 minutes, it's not coming out!! There was no manager to talk to, no one to come over to apologizes to us. No nothing. The place needs to practice better customer service. I didn't even get my water!

data.title: The outside matches the inside.
data.text: My first impression of the building should have deterred me from stepping into this restaurant but I thought I should give it a try. The chips that were brought to our table were soggy and the dishes and utensils at our table had specks of food on them. The pedestrian food was a disappointment. The only kind thing I can say about this restaurant is our waiter was good and had a friendly smile. This restaurant has the perfect location to be a successful business but fails to deliver quality food.

data.title: food is horrible
data.text: liked the red sangria that is all.. My food was bland and the chicken in salsa verde was so hard could not cut it . Very pricey for horrible food. Will not go back!

data.title: Flavourful but...
data.text: The food was flavourful but they skimped on the sour cream and guacamole for the flautas. Seems a shame as the meal was lovely otherwise.

data.title: El Tio...Top of my list! Bravo!
data.text:
Pure Excellence! 

I got introduced to quality Mexican food during my time at San Diego State in the early 70’s, and I have spent years traveling the US looking for the outstanding Chile Relleno and Chicken Enchilada combination. I found it at El Tio…repeatedly. 
I live on the West Coast and the next time I come to NYC, I might even bring my wife so she can experience it. It is that good! I had to go back to the kitchen and tip the cook! They do a remarkable job on a unique menu. 
Also, I am an agave nectar Margarita fan, and, by request to Omar, he makes a killer agave nectar Margarita! My five or six visits over a couple of years to El Tio have all been superb…an experience I always look forward to! Bravo!

data.title: Bad service and OK food
data.text:
Went on Cinco de mayo for lunch. The restaurant was not full but the waiter took our drink order and decided to play with his phone behind the bar for about 10 minutes before bringing our drinks - even the water. The shrimp soup was good but the fajitas al pastor had the taste of curry and weren't pleasant. 

In short service was poor and food wasn't the greatest so hence the rating. Maybe they new to be busy to prep good food.

data.title: EXCELLENT AUTHENTIC MEXICAN RESTAURANT
data.text: i loved it. the food was excellent. the service was great. this restaurant was located right across the street from the commercial chain's  of restaurant like applebees and buffalo wild wings (new roc city) . great place for a romantic dinner and/or hanging out with your friends. the price was very reasonable for the steak dinner i had. i have no complaints. the look of the restaurant was was very authentic to mexico. i had a very pleasurable dinning experience. i will return again.

data.title: Average to Below Average Food: A waste of money!
data.text: I wouldn't go here. The food I had was tasteless. The only reason they get two stars is because they gave me chips and salsa as many times I asked but the meal itself was tasteless. The dessert Tres Leches was just horrible and old. They need to improve the food and the menu.

data.title: The service could be better
data.text: The service could be better.  I visited with my wife and sat down, we were seated right away.  Our waiter asked us if we wanted drinks, my wife ordered a soft drink and I just wanted water.  After we received our drinks the waiter took too long to get our orders.  In fact, he never did, I had to place my order with another waiter who I managed to flag down.  I would understand if the place had been busy but it wasn't.  The food was alright but not great and certainly not worth the poor service.  The enchiladas are good but the tamales do not taste fresh, I would avoid them.

data.title: New rochelle mex
data.text:
Get a cadillac 
marg XX cheeps and mix fajita watch spanish TV and chat your booty offf fun place to enjoy  spanish culture or new rocohelles part anyway
